articles.description: All the latest football news and reaction to England v Greece in the Nations League plus build-up as Wales go to Iceland.
articles.title: Football latest: Nations League reaction as England faced Greece at Wembley

articles.description: Jack Leach takes the three wickets England require for a record-breaking win over Pakistan and a 1-0 lead in the three-match series.
articles.title: Pakistan vs England: Jack Leach seals record-breaking win in Multan

articles.description: Where does England's shambolic defeat against Greece at Wemble leave interim manager Lee Carsley?
articles.title: Where does England's shambles against Greece leave Lee Carsley?

articles.description: Cristiano Ronaldo remains a key member of Portugal's squad. BBC Sport looks at his role with the national team.
articles.title: Cristiano Ronaldo: Portugal forward's quest for 1,000 goals continues

articles.description: As INEOS Britannia prepares to compete for the 2024 America's Cup, BBC Sport looks at how Great Britain hopes to win sailing's most prestigious competition for the first time.
articles.title: America's Cup: Can Ben Ainslie and INEOS Britannia end Great Britain’s 173-year wait for victory?

articles.description: Skye Nicolson and Raven Chapman contest the first women's world title fight to be held in Saudi Arabia on Saturday in another key sign of the Kingdom's growing influence on boxing.
articles.title: Skye Nicolson v Raven Chapman: Saudi Arabia to host its first women's world title fight

articles.description: BBC tennis correspondent Russell Fuller on Rafael Nadal's enduring rivalry with Roger Federer and his legacy in the tennis world.
articles.title: Rafael Nadal retiring: Reflections on 'the son every mum would love to have'

articles.description: England start with a false nine experiment, end up in a rudimentary 4-4-2 shape, and lose to Greece on a damaging night for Lee Carsley's job prospects.
articles.title: England: What next for Lee Carsley as false nine Greece experiment fails?

articles.description: Craig Bellamy hopes to build on an 'exciting' start to his Wales tenure as his second camp takes the team to Iceland.
articles.title: Iceland v Wales: Craig Bellamy and the difficult second camp

articles.description: BBC Sport Scotland assesses the issues facing Scotland head coach Steve Clarke before facing Portugal and Croatia amid mounting injuries and poor form.
articles.title: Scotland: The key issues for Steve Clarke's struggling & depleted side
